Class TurnoverDeck

  • java.lang.Object
    • TurnoverDeck

  • public class TurnoverDeck
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to blueprint the turnover deck. Since this is a form of deck (Collection of face up cards), it inherits attributes and methods from the deck class
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Owain Gibson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TurnoverDeck()
      Constructor to instantiate the turnoverDeck object The default card back cover is applied, which can then be changed later if need be

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCard(Card card)
      Method for adding a card to the arrayList
      Card getCard(int cardIndex)
      Method to return the card at the specific given index
      java.lang.String getCardCover()
      Method for returning the card cover filename
      java.util.ArrayList<Card> getCards()
      Method for returning all the cards in the arrayList to the calling function It is passed by reference, rather than copy, so that the subclasses can call perform operations on it if needed
      boolean isShuffled()
      Method for checking if the deck has been shuffled
      Card nextCard()
      Method for popping the first card off the deck and giving to the calling function Also to save memory, every 10 card pops, the arrayList is trimmed to size (otherwise there would be a situation with 2 cards in a size 52 list)
      int numCards()
      Method to return the number of cards in the card arraylist
      Card popCard(int cardIndex)
      Method from "popping" a card from the arrayList.
      void setCardCover(java.lang.String cardCover)
      Method for setting the Card Cover for the deck
      void shuffle()
      Method for shuffling the cards in the deck
      java.lang.String toString()
      Method to return all the cards left in the pack

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • TurnoverDeck

        public TurnoverDeck()
             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Constructor to instantiate the turnoverDeck object The default card back cover is applied, which can then be changed later if need be
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the cards.txt file cannot be found

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to return all the cards left in the pack
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns them as a string

      • nextCard

        public Card nextCard()
        Method for popping the first card off the deck and giving to the calling function Also to save memory, every 10 card pops, the arrayList is trimmed to size (otherwise there would be a situation with 2 cards in a size 52 list)
        Returns:
        returns the card

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Method for shuffling the cards in the deck

        Parameters:

      • getCard

        public Card getCard(int cardIndex)
        Method to return the card at the specific given index
        Parameters:
        cardIndex - holds the index
        Returns:
        returns the card if the index given is within the range of card indexes, otherwise null

      • popCard

        public Card popCard(int cardIndex)
        Method from "popping" a card from the arrayList. This means that the card can be returned while also being removed from the list (inspired by Linked Lists)
        Parameters:
        cardIndex - holds the card to pop
        Returns:
        returns the popped card

      • numCards

        public int numCards()
        Method to return the number of cards in the card arraylist
        Returns:
        returns the number

        Method for adding a card to the arrayList
        Parameters:
        card - holds the card to add

      • getCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getCards()
        Method for returning all the cards in the arrayList to the calling function It is passed by reference, rather than copy, so that the subclasses can call perform operations on it if needed
        Returns:
        returns the arrayList
